City Council
============

1. City Council

City Council

* 2nd and 4th Monday of every month
* City Hall
  922 Estates Drive
  Woodway,
  76712

As required by the Texas Open Meetings Act, the agendas of the Woodway City Council are posted online at least 72 hours in advance of each meeting, and they remain online until the meeting has concluded. For copies of past agendas and approved meeting minutes, please feel free to email the City Secretary’s Office or call them at 254-772-4480, by fax at 254-772-0695.

Meeting dates are sometimes changed due to Monday holidays, and the Council customarily cancels the second meeting scheduled for June and July as allowed by the City of Woodway’s Charter. To confirm meeting dates and times, please email the City Secretary’s Office, or call the office at 772-4480.

The City of Woodway is a political subdivision and municipal corporation of the State, duly organized and existing under the laws of the State, including the City’s Home Rule Charter. The City was incorporated in 1955, and first adopted its Home Rule Charter in 1973.

The City operates under a Council/Manager form of government with a City Council comprised of the Mayor and six Councilmembers. The term of office is three years. The Mayor and Mayor Pro Tem are elected annually by the Council. Councilmembers serve on a voluntary basis without compensation and do not have an office at City Hall.

### The City Manager

The City Manager is the chief administrative officer for the City responsible for managing the day-to-day operations, employee supervision, and financial management.

### City Council Members

| Bio | Position | Email |
| --- | --- | --- |
| ![](https://woodwaytexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/2Councilmember-Qourzal.jpeg72-150x150.jpg)   Mayor Qourzal has served on the Parks & Recreation Commission and the Planning & Zoning Commission.  His first appointment was to the Parks & Recreation Commission in 2013 and then to the Planning & Zoning Commission in 2017. He was elected to City Council May 2019.  Mayor Qourzal is Associate Director of the Baylor University Career Center. | **Amine Qourzal**   Mayor   Ward 1, Place 2 | [aqourzal@woodwaytexas.gov](mailto:aqourzal@woodwaytexas.gov) |
| ![](https://woodwaytexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/2Councilmember-Cook-Copy-150x150.jpg)   Mayor Pro Tem Cook was elected to City Council in August 2020. She is a Licensed Professional Counselor in private practice with a Master of Arts Degree in Counseling and a Bachelor of Science degree in Political Science. Mayor Pro Tem Cook has served on several non-profit boards in the greater Waco area. | **Storey Cook**   Mayor Pro Tem   Ward 2, Place 1 | [scook@woodwaytexas.gov](mailto:scook@woodwaytexas.gov) |
| ![](https://woodwaytexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2020/09/Councilmember-Russell.jpeg5_-150x150.jpeg)   Councilmember Russell was appointed to Parks and Recreation Commission in 2014.  He was elected to City Council in May 2020. Councilmember Russell is an investor. | **David Russell**   Councilmember   At Large | [drussell@woodwaytexas.gov](mailto:drussell@woodwaytexas.gov) |
| ![](https://woodwaytexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/New-BE1A6763-2-1-scaled.jpg)   Councilmember Whitby served on the Parks and Recreation Commission before being elected to City Council in May 2025. He retired in 2017 after forty (40) plus years as a successful businessman in equipment distribution. He has an extensive background in developing budgets and operations management. | **Dave Whitby**   Councilmember   Ward 2, Place 2 | [dwhitby@woodwaytexas.gov](mailto:dwhitby@woodwaytexas.gov) |
| ![](https://woodwaytexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Councilmember-Sury-150x150.jpg)   Councilmember Sury was elected to City Council in May 2024. He is a communications specialist with the nonprofit Farmer Veteran Coalition in Waco after 25 years as a journalist and editor with the Waco Tribune-Herald. | **Ken Sury**   Councilmember   Ward 3, Place 1 | [ksury@woodwaytexas.gov](mailto:ksury@woodwaytexas.gov) |
| ![](https://woodwaytexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/Councilmember-Gilman-150x150.jpg)   Councilmember Gilman was elected to City Council in May of 2022.  She is an Organizational Development Specialist and Certified Training Professional through Texas A&M.  She has served on multiple nonprofit boards in Waco and is owner of Gilman & Associates. | **Janell Gilman**   Ward 3, Place 2 | [jgilman@woodwaytexas.gov](mailto:jgilman@woodwaytexas.gov) |
| ![](https://woodwaytexas.gov/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/Councilmember-Keyston-scaled.jpg)   Councilmember Keyston was elected to City Council in May of 2023.  Prior to Woodway City Council service, Keyston held similar positions on the Board of Directors for Crooked River Ranch in Terrebonne, Oregon as well as spending five years on their Architectural Review Board. Keyston has been in sales his entire life, mostly in commercial office leasing and car sales as well as holding real estate licenses in three states.  He has spent the last thirty plus years in non-profit Christian publishing with his company Healing Unlimited. | **David Keyston**   Ward 1, Place 1 | [dkeyston@woodwaytexas.gov](mailto:dkeyston@woodwaytexas.gov) |
